titlestmt.titleproper: Wagner Free Institute of Science miscellaneous instructional, curatorial, and administrative records 1888-1989
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science miscellaneous instructional, curatorial, and administrative records

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of miscellaneous material from the office of the curator of the Wagner Free Institute of Science. Box 1 includes: instructional materials, including handouts and final exams; printed materials, such as copies of the Institute's annual announcement and announcements for individual lectures and programs; sales ledgers for the Catalog of North American Devonian Fossils; a ledger of the Institute's real estate income and expenses for the years 1951-1958; and miscellaneous correspondence. Box 2 includes note cards on exchanges; member lists of the Leidy Microscopical Club, the Philadelphia Mineralogical Society, and other clubs; labels for an exhibit on commercial fur; director's draft and proof copy of Type Fossils in the Wagner Free Institute of Science; accession numbers of certain types of materials in the museum's collections, such as snakes and paleontology; and labels for missing specimens. Box 3 includes a photocopy of an obituary of James Bond, the ornithologist; instructional materials, including mineralogical labels from samples used in descriptive chemistry lectures; lecture notes and exam questions on botany; a book of solitaire games; and an illustrated guide to botanical terms presented to Professor Kaiser by one of his students.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
